intro: Gnaphalium thibeticum, commonly known as the Tibetan feather grass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its small, fluffy flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers produce a soft, white or pale yellow color. Gnaphalium thibeticum is often used in traditional medicine in Tibet for its purported health benefits.
